body:
### Neovim version (nvim -v)

0.7.0

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

N/A

### Operating system/version

CentOS 7.9

### Terminal name/version

xfce4-terminal 0.8.7.4

### $TERM environment variable

tmux-256color

### Installation

system package manager

### How to reproduce the issue

In Neovim 0.7.0, I am running a test that does the following steps:

1. Ask Neovim to send us an rpcrequest for rpc-1
2. Ask Neovim to send us an rpcrequest for rpc-2
3. Wait for those 2 requests to arrive from Neovim
4. Respond to the second request (the one for rpc-2)
5. Respond to the first request (the one for rpc-1)
6. Wait for the 2 responses to steps 1 and 2

Sometimes this succeeds and sometimes it fails. On success, the interaction looks like this:
```
Sent: [ 0, 23, "nvim_call_function", [ "rpcrequest", [ 10, "rpc-1" ] ] ]
Sent: [ 0, 24, "nvim_call_function", [ "rpcrequest", [ 10, "rpc-2" ] ] ]
Received: [ 0, 1, "rpc-1", [] ]
Received: [ 0, 2, "rpc-2", [] ]
Sent: [ 1, 2, nil, nil ]
Sent: [ 1, 1, nil, nil ]
Received: [ 1, 24, nil, nil ]
Received: [ 1, 23, nil, nil ]
```
On failure, the interaction looks like this:
```
Sent: [ 0, 26, "nvim_call_function", [ "rpcrequest", [ 11, "rpc-1" ] ] ]
Sent: [ 0, 27, "nvim_call_function", [ "rpcrequest", [ 11, "rpc-2" ] ] ]
Received: [ 0, 1, "rpc-1", [] ]
Received: [ 0, 2, "rpc-2", [] ]
Sent: [ 1, 2, nil, nil ]
Sent: [ 1, 1, nil, nil ]
Exception: (Failure "The connection was closed!").
```
When the failure happens, a log line appears in the low-level log file that says:
```
ERROR {time} {nvim pid} call_set_error:615: RPC: ch {chan} returned a response with an unknown request id. Ensure the client is properly synchronized
```
Is this a bug, or am I doing something invalid? I'm replying to the requests in LIFO order to avoid running into https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/19932, and I'm not sure what else I could be doing that's invalid. I'm also curious whether this problem reproduces on 0.8.0, which I don't have available to me at the moment -- I see there have been changes to [parse_msgpack](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/src/nvim/msgpack_rpc/channel.c#L238) since the 0.7.0 release.

comment_data.body: The issue here seems to be that the plugin is sending the response to rpc-1 before Neovim has had an opportunity to reply to the plugin with the result of rpc-2.

title: connection closed due to "unknown request id" with non-deterministic behavior
